required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Comparing the P200TE and the P200TxE in Glaucoma Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Qualitative OCT Image Grading Study Comparing the P200TE and the P200TxE in Glaucoma Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The study evaluates the image quality between two OCT devices.

detailed_description.textblock: The objective of this study is to collect OCT scans to compare the qualitative B scan images produced by the P200TxE to the P200TE device in glaucoma subjects.

primary_outcome.description: Results of a qualitative assessment of the B scans from each device from three independent masked and qualified graders using a four point scale (0-3) related to assessing retinal structures.

secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of safety will be assessed through adverse events reported by the site and documented on each subject's case report form.

intervention.description: The P200TE Ophthalmoscope provides widefield Scanning Laser Ophthalmoscope (SLO) fundus imaging and Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) imaging in one device.
The P200TxE Ophthalmoscope provides widefield Scanning Laser Ophthalmoscope (SLO) fundus imaging and Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) imaging in one device.
